subject: Re: [junit] About Struts Action Testing
msgSnippet: ... You need to be specific about what it is that you re trying to test. For unit testing, any reasonably complex logic should be in separate beans or POJOs
messageBody:
On 27/08/05, Soheil Dowlatshahi <soheildowlatshahi@...> wrote:
>
> Hello
>
> I have read your currently subject about Web Unit
> testing. I don't know that is it possible to use these
> tools or some thing like them for testing Struts
> Action classes?
>
> Yours Faithfully
> Soheil Dowlatshahi
>
>
You need to be specific about what it is that you're trying to test.

For unit testing, any reasonably complex logic should be in separate beans
or POJOs that are easy to using stubs or Mocks.
For functional testing, you might be able to use HttpUnit or one of the many
other frameworks to perform end-to-end testing.

James


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
